name: The Reject Demon: Toko Chapter 0 — Prelude
description: When a human is destined to die, the demons ferry their souls to the afterlife. ‘The Reject Demon: Toko’ is the story of Toko herself, a demon who has been kicked out of hell. Toko cannot ferry human souls to the underworld, and every day she stays on earth has her becoming increasingly human.

reviews.review_text: Lovely visual novel, if you are into ecchi and yuri you are going to love this one, the 5€ it asks for is more than worth it.  Pros: Fun original characters. Very good unique art style. The plot is fun and interesting.  Nice soundtrack Low price.  Cons: A bit too short. Sometimes the narrative can get a little confusing. Not many CGs.
kinda like if faust were a shounen anime but with lesbians A+
I really enjoyed this game. The whole concept, the songs, the art style (quite unique in my opinion), everything. I can't wait to play the next chapter!   10/10 if you like visual novels and yuri. ♥
Nice story, cute characters, and great tunes. It`s rare to have a yuri game this good.

Great VN with really good artwork and music. The story is engrossing and keeps you engaged though it is comparitivly on the short side. Enjoyable and can recommend especially if on sale. Cant wait for the next chapters.

Cute and interesting, The Reject Demon: Toko Chapter 0 - Prelude is pretty good. It definitely makes me excited for the next chapters  The character art is beautiful. The characters themselves seem defined and individual (No character shares too simular of speech patterns.) Sound design is good. The relationship between Toko and Nadia is cute and their personalities contrast and harmonize just enough to make the relationship feel genuine and sincere.  I loved the beginning story of how Toko and Nadia met, super cute!  The only thing I disliked is that Nadia's advances feel too rushed in the beginning, though that is later explained. Even so it made it difficult for me in the beginning before knowing the reasons for Nadia being so forward, it felt out of character for the Nadia that had just been presented. (This may be me looking too deep or just me assuming that Nadia wouldn't be the type to flirt like that in the beginning. I may just be picky.)  I tend to prefer to watch feelings develop over time, but this does make more room for us to see where the relationship goes and how it will change. Too many dating sims/ visual novels stop when the characters come together and you never really see how the relationship grows.  So in summary: It is worth checking out. and I'm excited to see how the dynamics of their relationship changes over time and with new challenges.
This game is so gay and cute.

This game takes the late 20th century overzealous Christian paranoia and turns it into actual lore. Rock and roll is actually the devil's music. The main character channels her super powers via the power of her bass guitar.  Wait, AND it's got lesbians? Who does this NOT appeal to? SOLD.
Quite a good VN ^_^  Even the music is actually good.

I would like to start this review off with a disclaimer, this chapter is AMAZING!   BUT, I am noticing a trend of VNs lately releasing things episodically, and there is nothing wrong with that IF you have an ACTUAL release schedule in place already. Right now this game is nothing but a tease with the promise of a game that will come.....eventually. No set release dates, no real promises, and very little information is given other than, 'we have two games coming out before releasing the other chapters for this.' And, of course, no set release dates on those either. So late leaves me here, buying a TASTE of a wonderful game or at least the idea of one with no view of the main course in sight.  To be fair, while surfing through the discussions I did see a post from the developer that stated that one of the games slated to come out before this one has some projected time periods of 'sometime during the winter, we hope, but not nessicarily this one.' That leaves me even more annoyed,  If they put out some proper dates on the future of this series then I will GLADLY change this review to a recommended because the setting, the characters and the story telling meathod are all so amazing, but until they get their release schedule in order I cant, in good heart, recommend this chapter to anyone.
